_exec_summary.SummaryText:
WhiteWave Foods Co.
CITY OF INDUSTRY-NORTH
RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM AND
PROCESS SAFETY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM
Anhydrous Ammonia Refrigeration System


Revised June 2009

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

WhiteWave Foods Co. is a leading manufacturer and distributor of shelf stable and refrigerated foods and beverage product, frozen food product, coffee and plastic containers. The company products are distributed throughout the United States. 

WhiteWave City of Industry-North Facility prepared a Chemical Risk Management Program and Process Safety Management Program (RMP/PSM) in general accordance with state and federal regulations. The state risk management regulations, also referred to as the California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) program, are codified in California Code of Regulations (CCR), Title 19, Section 2735.7, et. Seq.  The Federal Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) also regulates facilities with certain toxic and flammable substances. The regulations are codified in Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations (CFR), Part 68. Finally, both the Federal Occupational Safety and Health Association (OSHA) and the California Occupational Safety and Health Association (calOSHA) regulate facilities with certain acutely hazardous materials under the PSM regulations, as defined in CCR Title 8, Section 5189 and CFR Title 29, Part 1910, Section 119, respectively.

WhiteWave prepared the RMP/calARP/PSM to satisfy regulatory requirements and to demonstrate a commitment to evaluate and improve anhydrous ammonia handling systems and practices at the facility. WhiteWave Incorporated many state of the art safety features into the ammonia refrigeration system at the facility as part of the original system construction and subsequent system modifications. WhiteWave will continue to improve ammonia-handling safety through the implementation of the prevention program elements of the RMP/CalARP/PSM. In the unlikely event that a chemical release does occur at the facility, WhiteWave

personnel are trained in the appropriate evacuation procedures and will work closely with the county fire department haz-mat response team.

The City of Industry-North Facility is located at 18275 Arenth Avenue, City of Industry, CA 91748. The surrounding area primarily consists of industrial and commercial businesses.

Operations at the facility consist of the storage, processing, packaging, and distribution  of dairy products. The facility typically operates 24 hours per day, 365 days per year.

Anhydrous ammonia is used in the refrigeration at the facility. The system provides cooling for production areas, product and water chilling. The desired temperatures are maintained by controlling the flow of ammonia with manually and electrically operated valves, float switches, and compressor controls.

The RPM/CalARP/PSM regulations require a review of the five-year accident history at a regulated facility. This facility is reported no accidental releases of ammonia within the past five years.

The RPM/CalARP/PSM regulations require a review of the accidental release prevention program and chemical specific prevention steps used by the facility. Many safety features have been incorporated into the ammonia refrigeration system to prevent system failures and to mitigate potential releases. The safety features include but not limited to the following:

A?A  Emergency shutdown systems.
A?A  Pressure relief valves on vessels and compressors.
A?A  Engine room is equipped with ammonia detection system and ventilation system.
A?A  Many of the ammonia pipes, valves, and components are labeled.
A?A  A fire sprinkler system is installed in the plant.

In addition to the physical features of the ammonia refrigeration system at the facility, WhiteWave has extensive administrative controls in place to maintain safe operations of the system. Administrative controls include, but are not limited to, training programs for system operators and mechanics, emergency training, a hot work per

mit program, a lockout/tagout program, a contractor safety program, incident investigation program, mechanical integrity and inspection program.

WhiteWave recognizes the the RMP/CalARP/PSM program is a continuous process for evaluating, monitoring, and improving anhydrous ammonia handling operations at its facility. As such, this document, related attachments, and program elements will evolve as White Wave continues their ongoing focus and dedication of risk minimization and safety improvement for their employees and surrounding community. WhiteWave will submit revised information if a change occurs that is considered significant and requires resubmission under the regulations. However, minor improvements/modifications to the RMP/CalARP/PSM, related attachments, and program elements will be incorporated consistent with WhiteWaveA?fs internal review practices, and WhiteWave will maintain the most current versions on site. Thus, the most current version of the  RMP/CalARP/PSM  Program and related documents and elements maintained on site may vary slightly from the information in submittals made to EPA and other regulatory agencies.
